alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Blount Smoky Mountains; Campbell; Claiborne; Knox; Loudon; Morgan; NW Blount; Roane; Scott; Union (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 24 at 1:47PM CST until January 25 at 9:00AM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: .Several rounds of rain and possibly a thunderstorm will move across the Plateau, Tennessee valley and southern Appalachians mainly this afternoon through late Thursday. Training of moderate to heavy rains combined with the already saturated ground may cause flooding. Storm total rainfall will range from 2 to 3 inches with locally heavier amounts likely. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following areas, Anderson, Blount Smoky Mountains, Campbell, Claiborne, Knox, Loudon, Morgan, North Sevier, Northwest Blount, Roane, Scott TN, Sevier Smoky Mountains and Union. * WHEN...Through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The combination of recent snowmelt, saturated ground, and heavy rainfall will create conditions favorable for flooding within and near the flood watch area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
